H0.text: A nail rusting is an example of a new substance being formed.

H1.text: A wall being painted is an example of a new substance being formed.

H2.text: Water changing to steam is an example of a new substance being formed.

H3.text: Paper being folded is an example of a new substance being formed.

A4.text: Rust is a general name for a complex of oxides and hydroxides of iron, which occur when iron or some alloys that contain iron are exposed to oxygen and moisture for a long period of time.

A5.text: When iron rusts, the oxides take up more volume than the original metal; this expansion can generate enormous forces, damaging structures made with iron.
